results.title: Successful Treatment with Colesevelam HCl and Pravastatin in a Patient Previously Hospitalised with Severe Normal CPK Myopathy on Introduction of Simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Successful Treatment with @CHEMICAL_Colesevelam_Hydrochloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069472 @@@Colesevelam HCl@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pravastatin@@@ in a @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patient@@@ Previously Hospitalised with Severe Normal @<m>DISEASE_123320</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:123320 @@@CPK@@@ @DISEASE_Muscular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009135 @@@Myopathy@@@ on Introduction of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Moore JD. Successful Treatment with Colesevelam HCl and Pravastatin in a Patient Previously Hospitalised with Severe Normal CPK Myopathy on Introduction of Simvastatin. Clin Drug Investig. 2005;25(6):417-20. PMID: 17532682
citations.BibTeX: @article{17532682, title={Successful Treatment with Colesevelam HCl and Pravastatin in a Patient Previously Hospitalised with Severe Normal CPK Myopathy on Introduction of Simvastatin.}, author={Moore JD}, journal={Clin Drug Investig}, volume={25}, number={6}, pages={417-20}}

results.title: Dilated cardiomyopathy requiring cardiac transplantation as initial manifestation of Xp21 Becker type muscular dystrophy.
results.text_hl: A neurologically asymptomatic 32-yr-old man recently transplanted for @DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@end-stage dilated cardiomyopathy@@@ presented with progressively increasing serum creatine kinase level (@<m>DISEASE_123320</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:123320 @@@hyperCKemia@@@) while receiving @CHEMICAL_Cyclosporine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D016572 @@@cyclosporin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatine@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Piccolo G, Azan G, Tonin P, Arbustini E, Gavazzi A, Banfi P, Mora M, Morandi L, Tedeschi S. Dilated cardiomyopathy requiring cardiac transplantation as initial manifestation of Xp21 Becker type muscular dystrophy. Neuromuscul Disord. 1994 Mar;4(2):143-6. PMID: 8012195
